page.title: 09Elsenham CofE Primary School
page.content: doubles also as the village hall and so is quite large. The village hall has quite a lot of PE apparatus, a pine floor and a ceiling with sky-lights. In the main building of the school there is not a lot of glass but the school is by no means dark. There are five classrooms, a committee/meeting room above the hall, music room and a conservatory which has been commondeered as a computer room. Two of the classrooms are temporary, free standing huts which need replacing. Each of the classes has 30-35 pupils in it. The school has large playing fields and a large playground. The pupils interviewed all enjoyed there education at the school. Pupils favourite lessons were PE, music and maths. They all like their teachers too. School starts at 9am
